title: Verify functionality of the "SUPPLIERS" tab on the ERA application Home Page
custom_preconds: User should have logged in with valid username and password
custom_steps:
1. Access the following link: https://erastg.mlb.com/
2. Login with the following credentials:
Username: mlb_era_accountmanager@productiveedge.com
Password:Baseball2021
3. On the Home Page, select "Suppliers"  tab
4. Drop-down should display the following sections:
-Contracts
-Companies
custom_expected:
When selecting the "Suppliers" tab, a drop down with the following sections should display:
-Contracts
-Companies

- Enterprise
- Division
- City
- State/Province
- Country
- Submitted Date
- Action
- Details

title: ERA-Contracts "Due/In Progress" Table Features
custom_preconds:
As a user I want to verify the functionality of the "Due/In Progress" table features on the "Contracts" section.

User must be on the "Contracts" section
custom_steps:
1. Login to the Stage site
2. Click on "Suppliers" tab
3. Select "Contracts" section
custom_expected:
User should be able to:
- Filter (editable)
- Search bar (editable)
- Button to "Download Template" 
- Button to "Drag & Drop" a file from "Folders"
- Select File
- Button to open "Detailed Record" page to view Companies full details
- Sort arrows 
- Sidebar

title: ERA-Contracts - Due In Progress/Details button
custom_preconds:
As a user I want to see a specific "Detailed Record" of a company.

User must have selected the "Details button" on the table "Details" column
custom_steps: 1. When user clicks "Details" button, the "Detailed Record" modal displays
custom_expected:
Detailed Record table displays including the following columns:
- Status
- Contract/Version
- Enterprise
- Division
- City
- State/Province
- Country
- Action 
   *Drag & Drop button - opens the Folder icon to select or attach preferred folder or user can drag the preferred file 
   *Select File button - opens the folder icon to select or attach preferred file
- "Add New Comment" bar
- History
- Creator
- Time

 -Address 2

title: Keep "This is a New Address For This Supplier" Checked if it's a User Uploaded Address
Send email alert when manufacturer is approved or denied
Auto approve existing approved manufacturers
custom_preconds: As a compliance manager, I want to auto-approve manufacturers who are already in the system and approved so that I can save manual work.
custom_steps:
1. When a manufacturer is uploaded in the system and they both exist and already approved, auto-approve the manufacturer.
2. On the Contracts section > Due In Progress table > select "Download Template
3. Fill out the template with the required information from the manufacturer:
- Licensee Name
- MLB Contract Number
- MLB Contract Version
- Company Licensee Relationship
- MLB Territory Code
- Address 1
- Address 2 (optional)
- City
- State/Province
- Company Name
- AKA Company Name
- Product
- Option 1
4. Save the file
5. Go to "Contracts section" > Due In Progress > on the same row of the selected contract #, on the "Action" column, click "Drag & Drop" or "Select File" to upload the file that was previously saved.
6. The File Validation screen should open and the file validation process should start including the following steps:
- Pre Processing
- File Validation
- Address Validation
- Final Submission
7. If the uploaded file contains errors, user will receive a pop up screen with the following error message: "The file you uploaded contains critical error's. Please download your file and fix the identified errors" and the "File Issue Summary" including the details.
8. After the file is corrected and passes the "File Validation" step, then the "Address & Company Name Validation" modal displays including:
- Company Name
- Relationship
- Details
- Select Company Name table including the following columns:
 *Select
 *Accuracy
*Company Name
-Select an Address table displays including the following columns:
* Select - Click the button to select Company Name
* Accuracy - lick the button to select accurate address. If not sure, select "Melissa" who should give the best address accuracy
* Address 1
* Address 2
* City
* State/Province
* Country
* Zip Code/Postal Code
- New Supplier - Select if it's a new supplier
- AKA Name - select if the manufacturer has an AKA name
- Supplier Contact Information:
* First Name (Required)
*Last Name (Required)
*Phone Number (optional)
- Submit
- I Confirm all information is correct button
9. "Your file has been submitted and will be reviewed by the Legal Team" should display
10. Table should display including the following information: 
- Contract version
- Enterprise
- Division
- City
- State/Province
- Country
- Submitted Date
- Action - including button to download the "Legal Template"
- Details - Opens manufacturer "Detailed Record"

title: Upload of generated file for submitted contract from initial upload
custom_preconds:
As a user I want to verify that a generated file for submitted contract from initial upload can successfully be uploaded.

User must be on the "Contracts-Submitted" section
custom_steps:
1. Find a contract without a user uploaded file found in the Contract/Submitted page on the "Contract/Version" column.

2. Download the ERA system generated file by: 
-Downloading it from the "Actions" column
-Save in user files 
-Open the saved file, tweak it by adding Option 1 column
-Save modified file 
-Click on "Details" button 
-Under "Action" column "Select File"

Confirm it’s uploaded.


3. Download the ERA system generated file, tweak it by removing Option 1 column. Confirm it’s uploaded. 

4. Download the ERA system generated file, keep Option 1 column with data, confirm file goes through successfully. 

5. Download the file, re-arrange columns and upload. Confirm it’s successfully uploaded.
custom_expected: File should successfully upload in the system.

title: Generated file for submitted contract from initial upload cannot be uploaded
custom_preconds:
As a user I want to verify that a generated file for submitted contract from initial upload fails when duplicating data.

User must be on the "Contracts-Submitted" section
custom_steps:
1. Find a contract without a user uploaded file found in the Contract/Submitted page on the "Contract/Version" column.
2. Download the ERA system generated file by: 
-Downloading it from the "Actions" column
-Save in user files 
-Open the saved file, tweak it by duplicating the required field column by copying and pasting
-Save modified file 
-Click on "Details" button 
-Under "Action" column "Select File"

Confirm file does not upload.
